summary: Healthcare professional with extensive experience as a Clinical Analyst, nurse, and researcher. Proven leadership in appeals processing, quality assurance, training, and program management across multiple healthcare settings.

experience.title: Healthcare Clinical Analyst
experience.description: Led appeals across commercial, state group, and Medicare lines; collaborated with medical directors, medical policy, pharmacy, and others to render appeal decisions. Created training materials, mentored new employees, and delivered formal training across medical operations. Drove constant process improvement.

experience.title: Manager, National Children's Study
experience.description: Managed over thirty employees including data collectors and ancillary staff. Developed and implemented the QA program, ensured study integrity and adherence to protocol, conducted field training and inspections, evaluated compliance, and maintained quality of files. Managed the lab and supervised staff; prepared statistical reports for the principal investigator and identified trends for QA improvements.

experience.title: Oncology Nurse
experience.description: Administered immunoglobulin therapy, chemotherapy, blood products, hydration, and pain medications. Educated patients and families about medications and healthcare navigation, including self-administered subcutaneous administration. Prepared and administered chemotherapy and other medications; maintained central lines and venipunctures; assessed patient condition changes, evaluated labs, consulted on dose modifications, and managed symptoms.

experience.title: GI Infusion Nurse
experience.description: Performed venous and arterial punctures; maintained intravascular sites, monitored for infections, initiated emergency therapies, and assessed adverse reactions. Educated patients on therapy side effects and complications.

experience.title: Clinical Research Coordinator
experience.description: Coordinated a DNA collection study, including subject recruitment, informed consent administration, collection of case report forms, IRB collaboration, and report preparation. Worked with numerous surgeons and staff to identify eligible participants.

experience.title: FAST Program Coordinator
experience.description: Recruited, hired, trained, and supervised all FAST program employees; conducted site visits, managed budgets, and coordinated program evaluation. Responsible for grant writing/management, marketing, volunteer recruitment/training, and acted as liaison between FAST program and school faculty/administration.

experience.title: Research Coordinator
experience.description: Served as principal investigator for a study of complementary/unconventional cancer therapies. Developed a survey of oncologists distributed to major cancer centers; analyzed and presented data. Contributed to studies on cancer survivors and the Behavioral Research Database; helped create and distribute a membership directory.
